result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A Rowin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Time Served
Consecutive to: any other sentence

Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on April 1, 2022

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A Rowin

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

02:05 PM  Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mark A Rowin in court.

Court questions the defendant regarding today's hearing. Atty Juech states plea agreement.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and waives his right to an attorney. Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge. Defendant enters a no contest plea.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.   Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date.
Atty Juech makes sentencing recommendation and asks the Court to adopt the agreement. Defendant makes statement.

BY THE COURT: Ct 1
Court orders 3 days in Marquette County jail consecutive to any other sentence. 
Credit= 3 days
Time served
Court costs = $243.00
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge $200.00
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on April 1, 2022
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

02:46 PM Defendant Mark A Rowin appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Defendant states that he did receive an offer but questions the DNA sample.  Court explains the sample.

BY THE COURT:  Set plea/sentencing
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on February 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint and waives the reading.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.
  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
  The State will mail an offer to the defendant.

03:17 PM Defendant Mark A Rowin appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
    Court confirms address.  Defendant has a phone but it's not in service.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.
  Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  Atty Juech has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety  Status hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
